snippet: Insiders from the country’s nuclear industry described a culture in which regulators looked the other way while the industry put a higher priority on promoting nuclear energy than protecting public safety.
abstract: Insiders from Japan's nuclear industry say Tokyo Electric Power, operator of Fukushima Daiichi plant, and regulators had for years ignored the possibility of larger-than-expected tsunami and failed to take adequate countermeasures; say industry put a higher priority on promoting nuclear energy than protecting public safety and that the Fukushima accident is a wake-up call to Japan to break ties between government and industry.

byline.contributor: Yasuko Kamiizumi and Makiko Inoue contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Insiders from the country’s nuclear industry described a culture in which regulators looked the other way while the industry put a higher priority on promoting nuclear energy than protecting public safety.
